data.value: This is an implementation of the approximation algorithm detailed in . It chooses a set of edges from avail to add to G that renders it 2-edge-connected if such a subset exists.  This is done by finding a minimum spanning arborescence of a specially constructed metagraph.
Finding a weighted 2-edge-augmentation is NP-hard. Any edge not in
is considered to have a weight of infinity. The approximation factor is 2 if
is connected and 3 if it is not. Runs in
candidate edges (with optional weights) to choose from
key to use to find weights if avail is a set of 3-tuples where the third item in each tuple is a dictionary.
Finds an approximate min-weight 2-edge-augmentation of G.
Edges in the subset of avail chosen to bridge augment G.

link.data: # When the weights are equal, (1, 4) is the best
# Giving (1, 4) a high weight makes the two edge solution the best.
